conclusion: Analyze forces acting on block A in scenarios: θ = 37° and θ = 30° with cylinder B.
Block A is on an inclined plane at 37° in Figure A.
Block A and cylinder B are on an inclined plane at 30° in Figure B.
Forces on block A: gravitational force Mg, normal force N, friction force f.
Gravitational force components: parallel Mg sin 37°, perpendicular Mg cos 37°.
Equilibrium: friction force f equals gravitational force component parallel to plane, f = Mg sin 37°.
Calculate f: f = Mg × 0.6 using sin 37° = 0.6.
Forces on block A: gravitational force Mg, normal forces N1 and N2, friction force f.
Gravitational force components: parallel Mg sin 30°, perpendicular Mg cos 30°.
Equilibrium: sum of forces parallel to plane is zero, f = Mg sin 30° - N2.
Normal forces balance: N1 + N2 = Mg cos 30°.
Calculate f: f = Mg × 0.5 - N2 using sin 30° = 0.5 and cos 30° = √3/2.
Determine N2: cylinder is smooth, N2 is adjusted to minimize f.
Final calculation: substitute M = 4m, f = 4mg × 0.5 - N2.
Assume N2 adjusted to balance forces, friction force f = 2mg.
Final Answer: friction force of block A on slope when θ = 30° with cylinder B is 2mg.
